data.title: Events — The Reaumond Foundation
data.text:
2024 Fulton Market Summer Kick-Off Presented by The Associate Board

Get ready to dive into summer fun and philanthropy with the Reaumond Foundation's Associate Board on a Friday night! Wear your best white attire to match our summer theme and join us for an evening of elegance and excitement. Enjoy gourmet bites, refreshing drinks, live music, exciting raffles, and a silent disco—all while supporting pancreatic cancer patients!

Your participation also means providing access to our Homes of Hope condo in Houston, TX, at a minimal cost for those undergoing treatment. Let's come together for a night of fun and fundraising to make a real impact in the fight against pancreatic cancer.

For sponsorships and inquiries, reach out to us at (847) 624 1733 or info@bobsencore.org.

Event Details:

Date: Friday, June 21st

Time: 6-10pm

Location: 1375 W. Fulton Market, Rooftop, Chicago, IL 60607

Attire: White attire encouraged

Early bird tickets available until May 10th for $85.

Looking for other ways to get involved? Donate to our raffle!

Homes of Hope

Often, the best chance of a successful outcome for a patient with pancreatic cancer is to travel to a hospital far from home. Travel costs add up quickly, especially when patients consider lodging, transportation, and food. Patients who need housing for extended cancer treatments may need to spend several hundred to several thousand dollars, depending on their length of stay.

Homes of Hope aims to ease the financial burden of housing, provide better access to the nation’s top cancer hospitals, and provide a “home away from home” to families during their most difficult days.

View Event →

Knockout Cancer 2024 Presented by The Reaumond Foundation

About Knockout Cancer:

KO Cancer 24’ will bring together Chicago's top business professionals for an unforgettable evening of boxing, camaraderie, and philanthropy. We invite you to join us in the fight against pancreatic cancer, as we raise funds to support patients, families, and hospitals dedicated to serving them.

The event will feature championship amateur boxing matches that promise to keep you on the edge of your seat. Witness our brave participants step into the ring, demonstrating their skills and determination to knockout cancer once and for all. Beyond the thrilling boxing matches, the night will be filled with other exciting activities, including an open bar, delicious dinner, and live entertainment to keep the energy high throughout the event.

Sponsorship Opportunities

Interested in becoming a corporate sponsor? Please email info@bobsencore.org to learn more.

View Event →

Snaps with Santa Presented by The Reaumond Foundation

Please join us for Snap’s with Santa!

We're excited to invite you and your family to "Snaps with Santa," a magical, kid-friendly event presented by The Reaumond Foundation. It's a day full of festive fun where making a difference is the name of the game!

Date: Saturday, December 2

Time: 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM (Tickets available in two shifts: 10-12 and 12-2 PM)

$25 for adults, $15 for kids

Location: 24 E Washington, Suite 1375 Macy’s Building, Chicago, IL 60602

📸 Photos with Santa: Capture the magic of the season with Santa Claus himself. It's a snap-worthy moment for kids of all ages!

🎨 Face Painting & Ornament Decorating: Unleash your children's creativity with our talented face painters who will transform your children into festive characters, and design their own ornaments – perfect for adding that holiday sparkle to your tree at home.

🍔 Food and Drinks: Savor delicious refreshments as you mingle and connect with fellow attendees. Tasty treats await for you and your family!

✨ And More: Expect delightful surprises and heartwarming moments that will make this event truly unforgettable.

If you have any questions or need further information, don't hesitate to reach out to us, info@bobsencore.org

TICKET DETAILS:

View Event →

Aiming for a Cure Presented by BEAR Construction Company

The Reaumond Foundation invites you to join us for Aiming for a Cure Presented by BEAR Construction Company, where the rich history of clay shooting converges with a heartfelt cause. We invite you to be part of an extraordinary day filled with camaraderie, competition, and compassion, all in support of The Reaumond Foundation and individuals battling pancreatic cancer.

Together, We Can Make an Impact

Join us for a memorable day of clay shooting, compassion, and hope. Let's aim high, hit our targets, and shoot for a future free from this devastating disease. Together, we can make a difference.

12:00PM - Registration begins.

1:00PM – Shotgun start.

4:00PM – Post event refreshments and bar.

SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES & TICKETS:

Interested in becoming a corporate sponsor? We have opportunities available starting at $500. Squads of three start at $750.

ABOUT MAX MCGRAW WILDLIFE FOUNDATION:

We were born for the outdoors — for sport or serenity, with families and friends or even in solitude.

We champion America’s heritage of hunting and fishing as essential to managing our natural resources, and we’re dedicated to building knowledge, sharing experiences, and creating the memories that last lifetimes.

Our Mission Statement: “Secure the future of hunting, fishing, and land management through programs of science, education, demonstration, and communication.”

THANK YOU TO OUR SPONSORS

The 2nd Annual Reaumond Foundation Invitational

We are thrilled to invite you to the 2nd Annual Reaumond Foundation Invitational, hosted at The Glen Club. Please join us for a great day of golf and an even greater cause, supporting our efforts in pancreatic cancer research, patient and family assistance, and our Homes of Hope initiative.

12:00PM - Registration begins. Pre-golf lunch, drinks and practice facility available.

12:45PM – Pre-Golf announcements, instruction and plan of the day ahead

1:00PM – Shotgun start, on course food and beverage

5:30PM – Post golf dinner and open bar.

GOLF PACKAGE DETAILS:

$2,500 per foursome includes:

18 holes of cart golf

Complimentary access to practice range

Lunch at kick off

Golfer gifts

Unlimited Beer & Cocktails on the course

Open bar post-golf

Contest prize awards

Donation to The Reaumond Foundation

SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES:

Interested in becoming a corporate sponsor? We have opportunities available starting at $1,000.

ABOUT THE COURSE:

The Glen Club, designed by renowned golf course architect Tom Fazio, is a remarkable feat of engineering.

For over 70 years, the land was used as a Naval Air Base complete with runways and a total elevation change of three feet. Today, the land has been beautifully transformed into a dynamic terrain with rolling berms, stunning vistas and naturally harmonious transitions.

The routing features dramatic elevation changes – up to 40 feet on certain holes – mature trees and natural areas, meandering lakes and flowing streams. There are 75 acres of prairie grass flowing naturally throughout the layout.

Each of the spectacular par 3’s face a different point on the compass. The par 5’s are big and bold yet contain ample driving zones and generous bailout regions. The par 4’s range from short and sweet to long and tough. Many elements of a superb Fazio design are here and offer a challenge in many forms, from the classic perched greens undercut by bunkers to the awesome peninsula greens menaced by water.

The finishing 18th hole is one of the most picturesque on the course with two water features and strategically placed bunkers that demand accurate tacking from one safe area to the next. Walking off the 18th green will leave a lasting impression of a spectacular test of skill in an environment that offers an array of memorable golf holes.

HOMES OF HOPE:

Often, the best chance of a successful outcome for a patient with pancreatic cancer is to travel to a hospital far from home. Travel costs add up quickly, especially when patients consider lodging, transportation, and food. Patients who need housing for extended cancer treatments may need to spend several hundred to several thousand dollars, depending on their length of stay.

Homes of Hope aims to ease the financial burden of housing, provide better access to the nation’s top cancer hospitals, and provide a “home away from home” to families during their most difficult days.

THANK YOU TO OUR SPONSORS

View Event →

2023 Fulton Market Summer Kick-Off Presented by The Associate Board

Join the Associate Board of the Reaumond Foundation as we kick off summer on one of Fulton Market’s coolest rooftops. The event will feature local Chicago restaurants, an open bar, live music, raffle, and more. All proceeds from this event will benefit those facing pancreatic cancer, including opportunities to stay at our Homes of Hope condo in Houston, TX, for minimal cost while receiving treatment.

The financial and emotional burden can be overwhelming, and The Reaumond Foundation seeks to help those dealing with this deadly disease. Pancreatic Cancer has one of the lowest 5-year survival rates of only 12%. With your help, our goal to end Pancreatic Cancer will be possible in our lifetime.

For sponsorship opportunities contact us at (847) 624 1733 or at info@bobsencore.org

Thursday, June 1st 6-9pm

1375 W. Fulton Market, Chicago, IL 60607

Early bird tickets on sale until May 1, $75

Thank You to Our 2022 Sponsors

Knockout Cancer Presented by The Reaumond Foundation

About Knockout Cancer:

The Reaumond Foundation and Chicago’s top business professionals come together on Thursday, March 2, at the iconic Chicago House of Blues. Join us as they step into the ring to knockout cancer and raise money for patients, families, and the hospitals that serve them. The evening will include championship amateur boxing, an open bar, dinner, live auction and live entertainment. All proceeds from the event will go towards impacting the lives of those with pancreatic cancer.

Early bird tickets on sale now until 12/2! Get yours for $250 for a limited time.

Sponsorship Opportunities

Interested in becoming a corporate sponsor? We have opportunities available starting at $1,000.

Interested in becoming a boxer?

The Reaumond Foundation, in partnership with Unanimous Boxing and The Barracks, is excited to offer 3 months of personalized training to prepare you for a once in a lifetime opportunity to train as a boxer, while raising money for pancreatic cancer. Training will consist of an unlimited boxing gym membership at either Unanimous or The Barracks including 1:1 training and live sparring sessions, with the guidance of trained professionals in the ring. Each boxer is required to raise a minimum of $5,000 for our Foundation, which can be done through donations, ticket sales, corporate sponsorships, and more.

View Event →

1st Annual Reaumond Foundation Invitational

Over $117,000 Raised!

We are thrilled to invite you to the 1st Annual Reaumond Foundation Invitational, hosted at the beautiful Cantigny Golf Club. Please join us for a great day of golf and an even greater cause, supporting our efforts in pancreatic cancer research, patient and family assistance, and our Homes of Hope initiative.

12:00PM - Registration begins. Pre-golf lunch, drinks and practice facility available.

12:45PM – Pre-Golf announcements, instruction and plan of the day ahead

1:00PM – Shotgun start, on course food and beverage

5:30PM – Post golf dinner and open bar.

GOLF PACKAGE DETAILS:

$2,500 per foursome includes:

18 holes of cart golf

Complimentary access to practice range

Lunch at kick off

Golfer gifts

Unlimited Beer & Cocktails on the course

Open bar post-golf

Contest prize awards

Donation to The Reaumond Foundation

SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES:

Interested in becoming a corporate sponsor? We have opportunities available starting at $1,000.

ABOUT THE COURSE:

Cantigny offers 27 challenging holes on beautiful, rolling terrain covering nearly 300 acres. The Woodside, Lakeside and Hillside nines each have distinct identities, adding richness to the golf experience. Cantigny is the five-time host of the Illinois State Amateur Championship and frequent regional tournaments. When it opened, in 1989, it was named “Best New Public Course in America” by Golf Digest. Since then, it has earned a reputation as one of the finest public-access golf facilities in the Midwest. Cantigny Golf is owned by the Robert R. McCormick Foundation and managed by KemperSports. It is open to all but strives to deliver the amenities and playing conditions you might expect at a private golf facility. We aim to make your time here special, whether you’re playing a casual 9 or 18, practicing at the Academy, enjoying a meal, or hosting an all-day golf outing.

HOMES OF HOPE:

Often, the best chance of a successful outcome for a patient with pancreatic cancer is to travel to a hospital far from home. Travel costs add up quickly, especially when patients consider lodging, transportation, and food. Patients who need housing for extended cancer treatments may need to spend several hundred to several thousand dollars, depending on their length of stay.

Homes of Hope aims to ease the financial burden of housing, provide better access to the nation’s top cancer hospitals, and provide a “home away from home” to families during their most difficult days.

*The Reaumond Foundation and Cantigny Golf will abide by all state regulation and mandates as it relates to COVID-19. The event will follow protocol per city guidance and all event details as laid out are subject to change if required by the city. If cancellation or postponement is necessary, The Reaumond Foundation will work with all registered golfers to provide refunds if desired.
